page.title: 13NOTABLE BUILDINGS (CONT.)
page.content:
There are some notable half-timbered buildings mainly of the early 17th century.{ASTLEY TOWNE}and, nearby,{ {LITTLE ASTLEY TOWNE}are two fine examples on the road from the church past the school to Ridley's Cross. Near them is{POOL HOUSE,}also dating from the 17th century but altered greatly in the l8th century. The original l7th century windows have stone mullions and transoms.
On the road leading from the church down The Toot and up to the A451 Gt. Witley road is the hamlet of{ YARHAMPTON.{YARHAMPTON FARM}is a beautiful half-timbered house with its date, 1610, on the front. This can be seen clearly from the A451.
